ygData.subject: SV: SV: [EverQuest] Gaming Death
ygData.msgSnippet: I have seen and been involved in total party wipeouts, and they are no fun!  I d rather the Cleric survive it, maybe we ll get a Rez? You get the idea, but
ygData.messageBody:
"I have seen and been involved in total party wipeouts, and they are
no fun!  I'd rather the Cleric survive it, maybe we'll get a Rez?"

You get the idea, but you ain't there yet =P

Yeah whipe outs happen. It's a part of EQ, bailing clercs ain't. If event/raid leader calls out for clercs to log they do so, else they stay and die like everyone else =P Famous last words "CH on target. SoandSo's turn!".

-domi

-----Ursprungligt meddelande-----
Från: bigmaca3 [mailto:bigmaca3@...]
Skickat: den 18 juli 2002 23:31
Till: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Ämne: Re: SV: [EverQuest] Gaming Death


--- In EverQuest@y..., "LAINE. Mikael (Nol)" <laine@e...> wrote:

> If i got a clerc that would tell the group
they will bail as soon
as things
> starts to look bad i would just
stick around and wait for a real
clerc. The
> game is dull when played
safe, the game is actually fun when played
towards
> the limits of what
can be done.
>
> -domi

I have had Clerics and casters bail on me.  It happens.  People don't
realize that if they unload that big damage DD or DoT or heal for too
much too soon the mob is going to head straight for them.  It can be
hard to hold aggro on a mob when that happens.  My Ranger has had to
become good at peeling the mobs off the casters just to keep them
alive.  They'll never make it if they run!

I have seen and been involved in total party wipeouts, and they are
no fun!  I'd rather the Cleric survive it, maybe we'll get a Rez?

I play a Cleric from time to time as well.  He fights to the death
and beyond!  So he has a melee mentality!

Tul
